original_title: Prices of fried rice and Kottu dropped from today
original_body_lines: The prices of fried rice and Kottu will be reduced by 10% with effect from today (July 05), the All-Island Canteen Owners’ Association says.
Addressing a press briefing, the association’s president Asela Sampath said the price of a packet of Rs. 700 Kottu would go down by Rs. 70 while the price of Rs. 1,000 Kottu is reduced by Rs. 100.
The price reduction of fried rice and Kottu comes a day after Litro Gas Lanka announced its fourth consecutive price slash this year.
The 12.5kg domestic gas cylinder previously priced at Rs. 3,186 now stands at Rs. 2,982. Meanwhile, the prices of 5kg and 2.3kg cylinders were reduced to Rs. 1,198 and Rs. 561, respectively.
